title: 109_hr5321
content: The Act titled "Access to Better Choice in Dialysis Act of 2006" establishes a Medicare pilot project for more frequent hemodialysis treatment. The "Access to Better Choice in Dialysis Act of 2006" establishes a Medicare pilot project to measure the impact of increasing payment for more frequent hemodialysis treatment, with specific payment amounts for additional sessions per week. The pilot program under the "Access to Better Choice in Dialysis Act of 2006" sets specific payment amounts for additional hemodialysis sessions per week, with funding limitations increasing each year up to $90,000,000 in the fifth year of operation. The Secretary will collect data to measure the impact of higher frequency hemodialysis treatments on health status and healthcare expenditures, including for separately-billable drugs and patients' working status. Reports on the pilot program will be periodically submitted to Congress, with a final report due to Congress and the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission no later than 6 months after completion. The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission will evaluate the Secretary's findings and submit an analysis to Congress on the desirability of expanded Medicare payment for more frequent hemodialysis treatment. The Social Security Act defines "hemodialysis treatment" as therapy requiring blood access, excluding emergency or acute treatment. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services.
